evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features of the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 incident, including miscommunication and lack of coordination during critical phases.

slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The environmental or marking deficiency should align with the key features and characteristics defined for such deficiencies in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA context during the specified inspection period.

slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: Mechanical/control failure matches the key features observed in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25 during hist_t0_prelim.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25 during the preliminary historical timeline.

assumptions: Communication between tug crew and flight crew is representative of overall crew communication
The incident at TRP implies some coordination issue though not explicitly stated as communication breakdown
defeaters: Direct evidence of communication breakdown among flight crew during the incident
Clear indication that communication was effective and no breakdown occurred

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence shows communication between flight crew and headset operator and coordination between tug instructor and trainee, but no direct indication of communication breakdown among flight crew during pushback; the incident of the aircraft moving beyond TRP suggests possible coordination issues but is not explicitly linked to crew communication breakdown (H1-H4).
outcome.uncertainty_source: No explicit evidence of communication/coordination breakdown among flight crew; ambiguity whether the pushback incident was due to communication failure or other factors.

node.statement: Mechanical/control failure was present in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25 during hist_t0_prelim.

defeaters: Explicit evidence of mechanical or control system malfunction on the aircraft during the event
Maintenance or system logs indicating failure
Witness statements confirming mechanical/control failure

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.
After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence describes the pushback operation and the aircraft moving beyond the tug release point and hitting a barrier, but does not explicitly mention any mechanical or control failure of the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA. Thus, there is no direct evidence of mechanical/control failure (H1-H4).
